data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 15.07.2025 WOD1.Hang Power Snatch On the 1:45 x 7 3 Hang Power Snatches *start at 50% and build to 80-85% of 1 RM 2.Conditionig For Time: 100 Alternating Dumbbell Hang Snatches 100 V-ups 100 Single Dumbbell Reverse Lunges Sweat: 10/5; Tuck Ups Train: 12,5/7,5 Compete: 15/10
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

15.07.2025

WOD
1.Hang Power Snatch
On the 1:45 x 7
3 Hang Power Snatches
*start at 50% and build to 80-85% of 1 RM


2.Conditionig
For Time:
100 Alternating Dumbbell Hang Snatches
100 V-ups
100 Single Dumbbell Reverse Lunges



Sweat: 10/5; Tuck Ups
Train: 12,5/7,5
Compete: 15/10

movements.name: Hang Power Snatch
movements.instructions: 1. Start by standing tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your thighs. 2. Grip the barbell with both hands, slightly wider than shoulder-width, using a hook grip (thumbs wrapped around the bar, fingers over the thumbs). 3. Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly to lower the barbell to just above your knees. This is your hang position. 4. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you prepare to lift. 5. In one explosive motion, extend your hips and knees while pulling the barbell up close to your body. 6. As the bar reaches your hips, shrug your shoulders and pull yourself under the bar, rotating your elbows around to catch it in a partial overhead squat position. 7. Stand up tall, locking out your arms overhead. 8. Lower the bar back down to the hang position and repeat for a total of 3 reps. Remember to build from 50% to 80-85% of your one-rep max (1 RM).
movements.scaling: If you're new to this movement, you can use a lighter barbell or even a PVC pipe to practice the technique before adding weight.

movements.name: Alternating Dumbbell Hang Snatch
movements.instructions: 1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand at your side. 2. Hinge at your hips and lower the dumbbell to just above your knees, keeping your back straight and core engaged. 3. In one explosive motion, extend your hips and knees while pulling the dumbbell up close to your body. 4. As the dumbbell reaches your hips, drop under it and catch it overhead with your arm fully extended. 5. Lower the dumbbell back down to the hang position and switch hands. 6. Repeat until you've completed 100 reps, alternating hands each time. Keep your movements controlled and focus on form.
movements.scaling: If 100 reps feel too daunting, you can scale down to 50 or 75 reps, or even reduce the weight of the dumbbell.

movements.name: V-ups
movements.instructions: 1. Lie flat on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. 2. Engage your core and lift your legs and upper body off the ground simultaneously, reaching your hands towards your feet. 3. Your body should form a 'V' shape at the top of the movement. 4. Lower back down with control and repeat for a total of 100 reps. Focus on using your core to lift, rather than swinging your arms or legs.
movements.scaling: If V-ups are too challenging, you can modify by doing tuck-ups instead, where you bring your knees to your chest instead of reaching for your feet.

movements.name: Single Dumbbell Reverse Lunges
movements.instructions: 1. Stand tall with a dumbbell held in one hand at your side. 2. Step back with the opposite leg into a lunge, keeping your front knee over your ankle. 3. Lower your back knee towards the ground while keeping your torso upright. 4. Push through your front heel to return to standing. 5. Alternate legs with each rep until you've completed 100 total lunges.
movements.scaling: If you're new to lunges, you can perform them without weights or reduce the number of reps.
